articles.title: New public health emergency
articles.author: Md Mehedi Hasan
articles.summary: Rising temperatures, erratic rainfall, recurrent floods, saltwater intrusion and worsening air pollution in Bangladesh are putting a strain on the healthcare system. Waterborne diseases like dengue and chikungunya are thriving in warmer temperatures and extended monsoon seasons. The health infrastructure across the country is ill-prepared to meet the demands of climate-linked illnesses. Pregnant women and children are especially vulnerable.
